channel.title: Client jar
channel.description:
i jarred my client but when i open it it says: could not find or load main class: c: bla bla.. client.jar
please help me what do i wrong?

item.title: Client jar
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

codyorr4:

add my skype ill jar it, and teach you about it so you can do yourself.

Using Skype to finish up problems isn’t the best approach. If you post a solution on the thread, then people with the same problem can find a solution through just a simple search on a search engine. Which will promote new members for the community.

A basic synopsis of what everyone has said previously…
This problem is coming up because your server doesn’t truly start at whatever you’re setting it to. Can you post step by step what you did to JAR your client? My assumption is that you type the manifest in wrong. Main class shouldn’t be “c:/ bla bla bla” try jarring again but set it to client, and post your results.

Read full topic

item.title: Client jar

item.title: Client jar
item.dc:creator: @maul_ownz maul ownz
item.description:
@maul_ownz wrote:

[quote=“Lil_Smok3r, post:4, topic:546114”]In your run.bat it will have lines of code, and in those lines of code tells you what your main class is called.
Then, in the manifest, you use that main class that you found in the run.bat
Reply/message me if you need more help.[/quote]this is my run.bat:

@echo off
TITLE Run
JAVA -Xmx1024m client 0 0 highmem members 0
pause

Read full topic

item.title: Client jar
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

In your run.bat it will have lines of code, and in those lines of code tells you what your main class is called.
Then, in the manifest, you use that main class that you found in the run.bat
Reply/message me if you need more help.

Read full topic

item.title: Client jar
item.dc:creator: @maul_ownz maul ownz
item.description:
@maul_ownz wrote:

[quote=“Camballer, post:2, topic:546114”]Your manifest is not correct. It needs to be the same as the main class in your run.bat[/quote]i don’t get it?

Read full topic

item.title: Client jar
item.dc:creator: @Camballer Camballer
item.description:
@Camballer wrote:

Your manifest is not correct. It needs to be the same as the main class in your run.bat
